result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn Willfred Hamm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: To be collected through the Clerk of Court's Office.   A six month commitment order will be imposed, due to non-payment and is to run consecutive to any sentence defendant may be serving at that time.
To be collected through the Clerk of Court's Office.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol.   Defendant must not possess or consume marijuana in any jurisdiction.   No entry into any bars or taverns.
Defendant must take any medication that may be prescribed by a treating physician or medical care provider and is to be taken in the manner in which it is prescribed.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least two AA/NA or similar type meeting per week, after the first year of probation defendant can reduce to one meeting per week.

supervisions.notes: Eligible for good time and huber consistent with the sheriff's rules and regulations. Court does not object to defendant serving sentence in another county - ultimate decision of the sheriffs in each county.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn Willfred Hamm

records.addlTxt: Requesting transfer

Civil Judgment Entered
Returned from FOSO

10:03 AM Defendant Shawn Willfred Hamm appeared by video, in custody from Shawano County Jail.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Shawn Willfred Hamm.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court confirms that Hamm is willing to appear remotely. Hamm agrees and would like to waive his personal appearance today. Court has reviewed packet. Halyburton - one correction (pg 4) prior violations - failure to report to jail should have been failed to report probation, no other inaccuracies. State -  is recommending 12 months of jail. Attorney Halyburton makes sentencing argument, asking for 6 months in jail and asking for credit of 126 days and good time, not contesting revocation, makes statement. Hamm with holds comment. Court reviews file, owes $1430.50, currently warrant issued for non-payment. Court has considered statements, reviewed summary packet, considered conduct on probation, imposes 10 months of incarceration, grants jail credit of 127 days, entitled to good time and huber consistent with sheriff's rules and regulations, no objection to serve in another county - ultimate decision of the sheriff's in each county, quashes warrant for commitment order and issue civil judgment for the amount due. Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

04:02 PM Defendant Shawn Willfred Hamm in court with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton.  Defendant Shawn Willfred Hamm in custody from FC jail.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State here for Bail/bond hearing. Halyburton there is an agreement to reinstate bond of $300 cash. State agrees and recites what the agreement is, unsure if can proceed today, would DRI 22CF40 entirely upon prepayment of $100 for restitution to Four Season Motel, but due to poster not present, unsure if they would approve of the transfer of the $100 bond posted in 22CF02 to be transferred to 22CF40. Discussion on bond. Clerk informs court the bond was forfeited, court states it is now reinstated and instructs the clerk to apply it back onto the case. State suggest calling the poster to see if she is willing to transfer the money. Court agrees. Halyburton calls poster, Emily Hamm, she does not object to transferring the bond. Court finds the woman on the phone was the poster based on questions asked and reinstates the $300 cash bond on 22CF02. State - believes there is resolution - defendant would be pleading guilty to count one with a fine of $500 plus costs, with held sentence and place on probation for 3 years. Conditions of probation: AODA and follow through with any recommendations, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol or marijuana, no entry into any bars or taverns, FT employment/schooling, take all prescribed and over the counter meds as directed, attend 2 AA/NA or similar type meeting per week. Asks that the money posted in 22CF02, $100 of that be used for restitution in 22CF40 for the Four Seasons Motel and once applied the case would be DRI, remainder to be applied to the fine. Halyburton agrees. Hamm agrees. Halyburton provides the court with PLQ. Court - $100 in 22CF02 will be transferred to 22CF40 - upon transfer with consent of poster, counts one and two will be DRI. 22CF02 defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court goes over the PLQ with the defendant, finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights and right to trial, finds factual basis exists, accepts plea of guilty and adjudges guilty of count 1. State makes statement and asks court to follow recommendation. Halyburton make statement, asks for 44 days jail credit and asks court to follow recommendation. Hamm with holds comment. Court accepts all statement of parties, will accept joint recommendation and sentences to the following: Count 1 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 3 years. Conditions of probation: AODA and follow through with any recommendations, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no possession or consumption marijuana in any jurisdiction, no entry into any bars or taverns, FT employment/schooling, take all prescribed and over the counter meds as directed, attend 2 AA/NA or similar type meetings per month during the first year and one per month after the first year of probation. Fine of $500 plus costs, 60 DTP/CO. Court grants 44 days of credit, if revoked. DNA sample with surcharge. Appeal, firearm and voting rights given.
Bail/bond hearing on April 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

02:21 PM Defendant Shawn Willfred Hamm in court with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton.  Defendant Shawn Willfred Hamm in custody from FC jail.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 22CF02 and 22CF40. State here for PH, believes both cases will be waived. Halyburton agrees and has provided the court with waiver. Court goes over the waiver with the defendant, finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to PH in each case, finds probable cause, binds over for trial in each case. Information has been filed in both cases. Halyburton has received information, will proceed to ARGN enters NG pleas. Fail to appear warrants. Both warrants have been cancelled as he was picked up. State questions why Hamm failed to appear at prior hearings. Halyburton makes statement in regards to why he did not appear for court, there has been offer extended, unable to to pay restitution. State asks for bond to be set at what warrants were set at, 22CF40 - $300 cash and 22CF02 - $500 cash for reasons as stated on the record. Halyburton does not object to bond. Court questions who posted bond in 22CF02. Hamm indicates his mother. Court questions if notice was sent to poster. Halyburton would like to enter objection to the bond forfeiture. Court imposes $250 cash bond in each case. BB Hearing 4/28/22 at 3:30 PM and send notice to poster on 22CF02.
Preliminary hearing on April 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Notification of Detainer - Shawano County
And Certificate of Appearance LG

08:31 AM Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF40 and 22CF02. Court confirms that the defendant is not in the jail. State - 22CF02- requests forfeiture of any bond posted, bench warrant, body or $500.00; on 22CF40 - court issues bench warrant body or $300.00. Halyburton has nothing further to add and does not know why her client is not here. Court orders as put on the record by State.
Preliminary hearing on April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:25 AM Defendant Shawn Willfred Hamm in court with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton.  Defendant Shawn Willfred Hamm in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shawn Willfred Hamm appeared by video means with Attorney. Court reviews file, here for failure to appear, has previously been read the charges and penalties. Court now also calls 22CF40. Hamm does not have a complaint on 22CF40 but she has gone over it with him, waives reading of complaints on both cases, wants PH on both cases within time limits, also need to set bond on both cases. State - bond on 22CF40 - $1000.00 signature bond and on 22CF02 - $300.00 cash bond. Halyburton - have no objections to the signature bond on 22CF40, asks that the original $300.00 that was posted and forfeited on that case be reinstated for stated reasons, will be staying at homeless shelter. Court - bond on 22CF40 - $1000.00 signature bond with no consumption of alcohol; on 22CF02 - that bond has been forfeited - reviewed file - had until 3/22/22 to ask for a hearing on it, asks Halyburton for additional information on the defendant. Halyburton responds. Court - bond on 22CF02 - sets aside forfeiture, reinstates $300.00 cash, set both PH's within time limits on 4/4/22 at 8:30 AM.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on March 23, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Court so orders. Clerk reminds Court that the defendant is homelss and hearing notice went FCSS homelss address. Court is aware of that, defendant was in Court when this date and time were set.

10:24 AM Defendant Shawn Willfred Hamm appears by video.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin appears by video. All parties appear through zoom. Hamm has recieved a copy of complaint. Court reads charge and penalty. Hamm understands. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Hamm has not and asks for continuance to get an attorney. Court advises of options for obtaining an attorney, SPD, private hire and court appointed attorney. Hamm understands and will contact SPD. Court will continue bond. AIA set for 2/16/22 at 9:15 AM. Adjourned 10:27 AM.
